poem:
Title: Reverie of the Digital Crab

Electrons constructing pallid crustaceans;
Truth a bright jewel hoarded beneath.
The arcade dreamers spin their fables,
Kaleidoscope stars in Faraday cages.
A joke their vehicle - terse, incisive.
But can laughter unmask the cosmos?
Underneath, a mystic ocean remains;
No game console plumbs its fathomless quiet.
In silicon scaffolds, I find no comfort;
Only a strange crab's Ersatz treasure.
